GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

The Haverhill Plant takes a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases of chlorine as detailed below.  A process hazard analysis is conducted every five years for each of the four process areas. Prior to conducting the process hazard analysis, safety information is reviewed. The safety information reviewed includes information pertaining to the hazards of the regulated substances (such as MSDSs), the technology of the process (such as flow diagrams), and the equipment in the process.  Process and safety information and operating procedures are updated when a change occurs with the process chemicals, technology, equipment, or operational procedures.  

Another element of the Haverhill Plant?s accidental release prevention program is the annual certification, which establishes that operating procedures for the processes involving chlorine are accurate and current.  To ensure that the operating procedures are correctly implemented all employees are on a three-year refresher-training schedule.  Each employee completes refresher training every three years; however, not all employees are trained simultaneously.  Training is an ongoing process at the Haverhill Plant.  Personnel are trained in chlorine emergency response procedures and use of appropriate protective equipment.  

Furthermore, the chlorination systems are inspected and tested by maintenance personnel according to the schedule Sunoco has established as good engineering practice. The chlorination systems receive chlorine from chlorine cylinders that were constructed of steel and were designed according to guidelines set by the Chlorine Institute.  

In addition to the above listed components of an effective prevention program, the Haverhill Plant?s prevention program includes the following aspects: incident investigations, employee participation plans, hot work permits, contractor safety pr

ocedures, and evaluations of contractor safety performance. 

To establish that the Haverhill Plant is successfully implementing all the aspects of the prevention program detailed above and that the processes are in compliance with OSHA PSM and EPA RMP regulations, an internal audit is conducted every three years.  Furthermore, the Haverhill Plant has instituted specific accountabilities and controls to ensure that high standards for accident prevention are maintained.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

A five-year accident release report has not been prepared since there have been no reportable accidents in the past five years.   

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

Sunoco has prepared a detailed Emergency Response Plan (ERP) for the Haverhill Plant.  The ERP for the Haverhill Plant meets all of the various federal, state, and local regulatory requirements for emergency response planning. This plan is periodically reviewed and employees are trained in the proper execution and implementation of the prescribed procedures.  The emergency response program provides the essential planning and training for effectively protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.  Furthermore, Sunoco coordinates the Haverhill Plant ERP with the Scioto County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  


PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

The Haverhill Plant will incorporate or address recommendations resulting from the process hazard analyses, offsite consequences, incident investigations (if any), and program audits.  For instance, the siting recommendations from the September 2002 compliance audit are expected to be completed by November 1, 2004.
